Title: Senior Data Analyst (Revenue Intelligence)
Description:
AUTODOC is the largest and fastest-growing auto parts ecommerce platform in Europe. Present across 27 countries with over 5,500 employees, AUTODOC generated revenue of over ‚Ç¨1.5 billion in 2024, supplying more than 8.4 million active customers with its 6.6 million vehicle parts and accessories for car, truck, and motorcycle brands.

Curious minds, adventurous experts and tech-savvy professionals - one team, one billion euros revenue. Catch the ride!




üåç Hybrid from Berlin, Germany




Job Description

We‚Äôre looking for a professional who can identify and escalate negative and positive trends in main customer and category KPIs to boost the company‚Äôs growth and profitability.




Responsibilities

Conduct in-depth economic analyses on current trading performance, market research, demand forecasting, pricing strategies, and competitor analysis.
Develop and maintain economic models to predict key performance indicators (KPIs) such as sales, revenue, and customer behavior and monitor those against actual performance outcomes.
Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for growth.
Conduct and analyze A/B testing and other experiments to evaluate the impact of different marketing and pricing strategies.
Prepare clear and concise reports to communicate findings and recommendations to the management.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement data-driven solutions and drive business growth.




Job Requirements

Master's degree in Economics, Business and/or Finance, Econometrics, or a related quantitative field.
2-5 years of experience in economic analysis or FP&A, preferably within the e-commerce, retail or technology industry.
Proficiency in SQL.
Proficiency in statistical software such as Python, R or Stata.
Basic knowledge of causal inference methods.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to think critically and independently.
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Excellent communication and presentation skills with the ability to explain complex concepts to non-technical audiences.
Strong teamwork and collaboration skills.
Fluent English.




What do we offer?

Competitive salaries based on your professional experience
Fast growing international company with stable employment
Annual vacation and 1 additional day off on your birthday
Mental Wellbeing Program ‚Äì providing you and your immediate family members with free and confidential mental and physical health support services for a wide range of personal and work-related issues.
Opportunities for advancement, further trainings (over 650 courses on soft and hard skills on our e-learning platform) and coaching
Free English and German language classes
Referral Program with attractive incentives
Flexible working hours and hybrid work

Company: DKSR - Data Competence Center for Cities & Regions
Description:

du strukturierst Daten f√ºr Visualisierungen durch Dashboards oder andere Frontend-Komponenten.

Erfahrung in Cloud Technologien, Containerisierung oder git.


Warum wir?

Du fragst dich, wie du einen sinnvollen Beitrag zur Bew√§ltigung dr√§ngender Herausforderungen unseres Zeitalters leisten kannst? Wenn du auf der Suche bist nach einer M√∂glichkeit, deine Leidenschaft f√ºr Daten in Projekte einzubringen und damit gro√üe Herausforderungen wie Mobilit√§tswende, Klimaschutz und Digitalisierung anzugehen, dann haben wir ein gro√üartiges Angebot f√ºr dich!

Was Dich Erwartet

Bei DKSR bieten wir ein lebendiges, offenes und modernes Umfeld, in dem engagierte Menschen mit viel Eigeninitiative und Pioniergeist Au√üergew√∂hnliches erreichen. Wir suchen keine fertigen Superheld*innen: Wir wollen helle K√∂pfe, die offen und neugierig sind und mit uns wachsen wollen.

Wir Bieten Dir


ein spannendes Bet√§tigungsfeld in den Bereich‚ÄØSmart City‚ÄØund Digitalisierung‚ÄØan der Schnittstelle zwischen √∂ffentlicher Hand und Unternehmen, St√§dten und Start-Ups
flache Hierarchien und viel pers√∂nlichen Gestaltungsspielraum
Zusammenarbeit‚ÄØmit hochmotivierten Kolleg*innen aus den unterschiedlichsten Branchen und Disziplinen in einer teamorientierten Unternehmenskultur
eine gemeinwohl- und zukunftsorientierte T√§tigkeit in einem an Bedeutung zunehmenden Themenfeld


Und au√üerdem:


eine gro√üz√ºgige Verg√ºtung
flexible Arbeitszeiten mit Homeoffice-M√∂glichkeit‚ÄØ(Laptop wird gestellt)
Arbeitsort flexibel (Berlin ist w√ºnschenswert, K√∂ln oder M√ºnchen ist m√∂glich)


√úber uns

Wir sind ein Team aus Expert*innen f√ºr Stadtentwicklung, Stadtplanung, Nachhaltigkeit und f√ºr Daten. Uns eint eine klare Vision: √ñkologisch wertvolle, sozial gerechte und wirtschaftlich attraktive St√§dte und Regionen, die ihre komplexen Herausforderungen zielsicher meistern, weil sie alle Informationen haben, die sie dazu brauchen.

Nachhaltigkeit und Resilienz

F√ºr nachhaltig smarte St√§dte und Regionen

Nachhaltigkeit ist f√ºr uns keine leere Worth√ºlse. Wir verstehen Nachhaltigkeit ganzheitlich. Wenn Sie mit uns zusammenarbeiten, k√∂nnen Sie sich darauf verlassen, dass wir Umwelt, Soziales und Wirtschaft gleichwertig zusammendenken, damit Sie diese drei Dimensionen in Ihrer Stadt oder Kommune ins Gleichgewicht bringen k√∂nnen. Denn Nachhaltigkeit ist f√ºr uns der Schl√ºssel zur urbanen Resilienz und damit f√ºr die Reaktions- bzw. Widerstandsf√§higkeit von St√§dten und Regionen.

Wir wissen, dass unsere unternehmerische T√§tigkeit Umweltbelastungen mit sich bringt. Deshalb nehmen wir unsere Verantwortung ernst und arbeiten best√§ndig daran, unsere √∂kologischen Auswirkungen zu minimieren. Das erreichen wir, indem wir auch im √∂kologischen Sinne auf bestm√∂gliche Technologien und Datensparsamkeit setzen. Nachhaltigkeit ist f√ºr uns ein Prozess, bei dem es darum geht, aus Fehlern zu lernen, mit Herausforderungen zu wachsen und immer besser zu werden.

Daten

Die Grundlage f√ºr nachhaltig smarte St√§dte

Unsere Arbeit basiert auf Daten. Daher setzen wir hohe Anspr√ºche an sie, unsere Technologien und unsere Leistungen ‚Äì konkret an Qualit√§t, Ethik, Transparenz, Sicherheit und Impact. Auf Basis von qualitativ hochwertigen Daten, Analysen und nutzerfreundlichen Datentechnologien wollen wir genau die Informationen bereitstellen, die Sie brauchen, um Ihre Stadt oder Region proaktiv nachhaltig gestalten zu k√∂nnen. So wollen wir dazu beitragen, dass Sie Ihre st√§dtischen Steuerungs- und Planungsprozesse effizient und effektiv gestalten k√∂nnen. Dabei achten wir auf Datensicherheit und halten hohe Standards der Datenethik ein, auch und besonders bei dem Schutz von Pers√∂nlichkeitsrechten.

Gemeinsam zum Ziel

F√ºr gute L√∂sungen

Nachhaltige Entwicklung gelingt in unseren Augen nur, wenn viele gute L√∂sungen zusammenkommen. Deshalb ist Kooperation und Gemeinschaft eine wichtige Basis unserer Arbeit. Wir arbeiten eng mit unseren Kund*innen, Partner*innen und als Team zusammen, um gemeinsam zukunftsf√§hige L√∂sungen zu realisieren. Auch unseren Datentechnologien sollen Kooperation erm√∂glichen, weshalb wir sie weitestm√∂glich als Open Source L√∂sungen entwickeln. Als Praxispartner von Fraunhofer und durch unsere enge Zusammenarbeit mit Expert*innen urbaner Dom√§nen, wie Klima, Energie, Mobilit√§t und Gesundheitsversorgung, wollen wir die Grundlage daf√ºr schaffen, dass St√§dte und Regionen ihren Weg zur Smart City zielsicher gehen k√∂nnen.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you looking for a new challenge?

Fancy helping us shape the future of motor insurance?

Prima could be the place for you.

Since 2015, we‚Äôve been using our love of data and tech to rethink motor insurance and bring drivers a great experience at a great price. Our story began in Italy, where we‚Äôve quickly become the number one online motor insurance provider. In fact, we‚Äôre trusted by over 4 million drivers. And now we‚Äôre expanding to help millions more drivers in the UK and Spain.

To help fuel that growth, we need a Data Analyst to join our Online Sales Team.

This team serves both our business and our customers.

As part of this team, you‚Äôll optimise our online products, making sure they meet user needs and convert. You‚Äôll also help strengthen our relationship with third party partners, such as price comparison websites, so we can better connect with our audience and turn more clicks into sales.

Excited to make an impact? Here are the details

What You'll Do


Analyse data from various business areas, including online conversion, operational efficiency, trading reports and strategic projects.
Identify improvement opportunities and support data-driven decision making in collaboration with teams like Pricing, Underwriting, Product & Engineering, UX, Customer Care and Claims.
Design and maintain dashboards in Tableau to monitor performance of the metrics that matter, as well as impact of initiatives to enable deeper analysis.
Participate in the integration and automation of data exchange between local and global teams.
Collaborate with other Data Analysts and Data Scientists to share best practices and strengthen Prima‚Äôs data-driven culture.
Support and lead key business initiatives, including the launch of new channels and propositions.
Manage successful relationships with 3rd party commercial partners.


What We're Looking For


A minimum of 2‚Äì3 years of professional experience is required in data analytics, management consulting, or other roles that are analytically driven.
A Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative or analytical field such as Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, Business Administration, or Economics.
A solid understanding of business in regulated industries
Excellent analytical mindset and problem solving skills
A keenness and confidence in stakeholder management, both internally and externally.


Nice to Have


Proficiency with SQL, Python, Excel & Tableau
Experience with cloud data platforms (e.g., Databricks)
Understanding of or interest in UK Motor Insurance


Why You‚Äôll Love It Here

ü§∏ Work Your Way: Enjoy hybrid working, with a mix of home and office days. Plus, for up to 30 days per year, work from anywhere.

Are you looking for a new challenge?

Fancy helping us shape the future of motor insurance?

Prima could be the place for you.

Since 2015, we‚Äôve been using our love of data and tech to rethink motor insurance and bring drivers a great experience at a great price. Our story began in Italy, where we‚Äôve quickly become the number one online motor insurance provider. In fact, we‚Äôre trusted by over 4 million drivers. And now we‚Äôre expanding to help millions more drivers in the UK and Spain.

To help fuel that growth, we need a Data Analyst to join our Online Sales Team.

This team serves both our business and our customers.

As part of this team, you‚Äôll optimise our online products, making sure they meet user needs and convert. You‚Äôll also help strengthen our relationship with third party partners, such as price comparison websites, so we can better connect with our audience and turn more clicks into sales.

Excited to make an impact? Here are the details

What You'll Do

  • Analyse data from various business areas, including online conversion, operational efficiency, trading reports and strategic projects.
  • Identify improvement opportunities and support data-driven decision making in collaboration with teams like Pricing, Underwriting, Product & Engineering, UX, Customer Care and Claims.
  • Design and maintain dashboards in Tableau to monitor performance of the metrics that matter, as well as impact of initiatives to enable deeper analysis.
  • Participate in the integration and automation of data exchange between local and global teams.
  • Collaborate with other Data Analysts and Data Scientists to share best practices and strengthen Prima‚Äôs data-driven culture.
  • Support and lead key business initiatives, including the launch of new channels and propositions.
  • Manage successful relationships with 3rd party commercial partners.

What We're Looking For

  • A minimum of 2‚Äì3 years of professional experience is required in data analytics, management consulting, or other roles that are analytically driven.
  • A Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative or analytical field such as Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, Business Administration, or Economics.
  • A solid understanding of business in regulated industries
  • Excellent analytical mindset and problem solving skills
  • A keenness and confidence in stakeholder management, both internally and externally.

Nice to Have

  • Proficiency with SQL, Python, Excel & Tableau
  • Experience with cloud data platforms (e.g., Databricks)
  • Understanding of or interest in UK Motor Insurance

Why You‚Äôll Love It Here

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Zoopla is one of the UK's most instantly recognisable property brands. In fact, we're known and loved by over 91% of the nation (and we're working hard on the other 9%). Our mission is to help the nation make better home decisions - by connecting everyone to their home and giving them personalised insights to help with moving, managing or financing. Over 50 million people visit Zoopla every month to access exclusive data and information on every UK property, search over 500,000 homes for sale and rent, find the best agents and secure the latest mortgage deals.

We're a growing, dynamic team that embraces innovation and isn't afraid to push the boundaries. We're only just starting our journey to redefine the digital property landscape, with much more to explore and achieve. Join us, and transform the way the nation makes home decisions.

We're a growing, dynamic team that embraces innovation and isn't afraid to push the boundaries. We're only just starting our journey to redefine the digital property landscape, with much more to explore and achieve. Join us, and transform the way the nation makes home decisions.


Position Overview



Every month millions of people visit Zoopla searching over 500,000 homes for sale and rent, finding the best agents and securing the latest mortgage deals looking for help on one of the biggest decisions in life. Where's my next home going to be?

We want to help even more people make better property decisions, and that's why we care so much about data. Whether someone is looking for their next home or an estate agent is looking to list, we need a best-in-class journey for both. Measurement, experimentation, and insights are the keys to unlocking this.


Responsibilities


Taking ownership of the data relationship with business stakeholders
With support from the rest of the Analytics team
Reporting on our baseline performance and trends. Keeping our finger on the pulse.
Driving us towards a self-serve first culture
Reporting on complex experimentation
Close analyst-stakeholder relationships are the most crucial component of a well-functioning data team. Stakeholders should consider you part of their team.
Varied work across other data disciplines, e.g. dashboarding, AE modelling, business unit level deep dives and data sprints, supporting ML projects.
We make time for innovation, so if you have an idea, shout, and we'll make the space.


What does a great candidate look like


Demonstrates curiosity and a proactive approach to learning, constantly seeking opportunities to deepen understanding and explore new ideas
Exhibits a strong desire for ownership and accountability, taking the initiative to drive projects forward and deliver impactful results
Skilled at translating complex business challenges into actionable data insights, driving meaningful outcomes and business impact
Excellent communication skills, able to convey ideas clearly and effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
While recognising the value of experience, greater emphasis is placed on finding the right cultural fit and individual capabilities for the role.
Strives to set high standards and continually seeks opportunities for personal and team growth, fostering an environment of continuous improvement
Inspired by the prospect of contributing to industry innovation and eager to participate in reimagining the future landscape


Technical Skills



Essential

Proficient in SQL with a proven track record of handling complex data queries and manipulation
Demonstrable experience with Tableau or similar data visualisation tools, including the ability to create insightful and user-friendly dashboards and reports
Experience with DBT (Data Build Tool) or similar data transformation technologies, with a keen understanding of data modelling and ETL processes

Desirable

A background in statistics and/or programming, with the ability to apply statistical methods and algorithms to extract insights from data
Especially surrounding experimentation
Familiarity with machine learning (ML) and artificial intelligence (AI) techniques, preferably in Python, R, or another programming language, enabling the development and implementation of predictive models and data-driven solutions



Benefits


Everyday Flex - greater flexibility over where and when you work
25 days annual leave + extra days for years of service
Day off for volunteering & Digital detox day
Festive Closure - business closed for period between Christmas and New Year
Cycle to work and electric car schemes
Free Calm App membership
Enhanced Parental leave
Fertility Treatment Financial Support
Group Income Protection and private medical insurance
Gym on-site in London - or membership in regional offices
7.5% pension contribution by the company
Discretionary annual bonus up to 10% of base salary
Show more

  • 25 days annual leave + extra days for years of service

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About the Role

My client is seeking a highly analytical and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our growing team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data visualization tools such as Tableau and Power BI, with proven experience in producing high-quality reports and dashboards for business stakeholders. Prior experience in the fintech sector is a plus.




Key Responsibilities

Design, build, and maintain dashboards and reports using Tableau and Power BI
Translate complex data into clear and actionable insights for internal stakeholders
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather reporting requirements and define KPIs
Ensure data accuracy and integrity across reporting systems
Conduct data analysis to support decision-making processes
Present findings and insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders




Required Skills & Experience

3+ years of experience in a Data Analyst or similar role
Proficient in Tableau and Power BI for reporting and visualization
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
Demonstrated experience in creating business reports and performance dashboards
Experience working with stakeholders across multiple departments
Strong communication skills with the ability to explain data concepts clearly




Nice to Have

Experience in the fintech / Payments industry
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, or a related field
Familiarity with SQL, Python, or other data analysis tools




This is a hybrid role with 3 days on site and 2 days from home with a 2 - 3 stage interview process.




Apply now to be considered!

Title: Low-Code Developer
Description:
Blue Code is hiring a Low-Code Developer who can step into a fast-moving Professional Services team and work on one (sometimes more) of the clients core business systems. Together with the team you design, build and maintain thinkwise applications that keep our customers ahead of the curve. Your daily mix looks like this:


Analyse requirements, design the smartest solution and build it (low-code and the occasional high-code tweak), test, document and run it in production.
Contribute fresh ideas for process innovation and application evolution.
Keep quality high on critical apps for household-name companies.


Every week we ring-fence time for your personal and team development. In consultation with your lead you decide whether that‚Äôs a hands-on workshop, a certification sprint or shadowing a senior colleague.

Requirements


Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs Degree (IT focus preferred).
Minimum 3 years of relevant experience in software development.
Exposure to both low-code and traditional high-code environments (study projects, internships or work).
SQL skills are a plus.
A genuine buzz from exploring the newest low-code and application-modernisation trends.
Result-oriented, pragmatic, creative and tech-curious.
Energised by juggling multiple customer environments.
Able to translate epics into clear tasks and keep momentum.
A true team player with a growth mindset.
Fluent in English, spoken and written.


Benefits


Full time job - 40h per week
Competitive and negociable salary based on experience and skills.
Annual salary review
International environment
Hybrid work model - 2 days office in Alicante and 3 days remote
Long term stable project
Internal growth potential
Regular informal team outings in Alicante
Annual team meetings in the Netherlands
Show more

Title: Security Engineer Intern (relocate to London)
Description:
At Bending Spoons, we‚Äôre striving to build one of the all-time great companies. A company that serves a huge number of customers. A company where team members grow to their full potential. A company that functions at unparalleled levels of effectiveness and efficiency. A company that creates value for shareowners at an extraordinary rate. And a company that does so while adhering to high ethical standards.

To achieve this objective, we execute the following strategy: We acquire a digital business with untapped potential and make it as successful as we can by leveraging our platform‚Äîwhich comprises our expertise, technologies, data, brand, talents, and company culture. Then, we invest the proceeds into making our platform more powerful, and into acquiring new businesses. Thus, our strategy sees us combine an investor‚Äôs attention to capital allocation with the hands-on approach of an operator.

For a talented, driven, and collaborative individual, working at Bending Spoons is an opportunity to learn, make an impact, and progress their career at an exceptionally high rate. That‚Äôs our promise to such a candidate.

A few examples of your responsibilities
Run security audits, identifying security loopholes and opportunities to enhance the effectiveness of security strategies.
Perform internal vulnerability testing, uncovering any weaknesses in the systems and implementing countermeasures to ensure the integrity of all data.
Identify company-wide security challenges. Design and implement solutions to strengthen protection and streamline security practices across IT and infrastructure areas.
Collaborate closely with privacy experts to ensure the most robust and complete privacy compliance strategy possible, and to translate regulations into tech implementations.
Stay up to date with security trends and threats. Share knowledge with Spooners to ensure data protection best practices and help foster a security-focused culture across the company.


What we look for
Reasoning ability. Given the necessary knowledge, you can solve complex problems. You think from first principles, and structure your ideas sharply. You resist the influence of biases. You identify and take care of the details that matter.
Drive. You‚Äôre extremely ambitious in everything you do‚Äîand your initiative, effort, and tenacity match the intensity of your ambition. You feel deeply responsible for your work. You hold yourself to a high‚Äîand rising‚Äîbar.
Team spirit. You give generously and without the expectation of receiving in return. You support the best idea, not your idea. You're always happy to get your hands dirty to help your team. You‚Äôre reliable, honest, and transparent.
Proficiency in English. You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.


What we offer
Incredibly talented, entrepreneurial teams. You‚Äôll work in small, result-oriented, autonomous teams alongside some of the brightest people in your field.
An exceptional opportunity for growth. We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potential‚Äîthen, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you‚Äôve got what it takes, you‚Äôll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.
Competitive pay and access to equity in the company. Typically, we offer an individual at the start of their career a salary of ¬£66,779 in the UK and ‚Ç¨63,965 elsewhere. If they possess a few years of relevant experience, the salary on offer tends to be between ¬£110,389 and ¬£149,636 in the UK, and ‚Ç¨105,737 and ‚Ç¨143,330 elsewhere. Pay grows rapidly as you accumulate experience and translate it into greater impact. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.
All. These. Benefits. Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top-of-the-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.


Commitment & contract
Internship. Full-time or part-time.

Location
Milan (Italy), London (UK).

Before you apply
Bending Spoons is a demanding environment: We're extremely ambitious and we ask a lot of ourselves and one another. While this tends to lead to fantastic learning, achievements, and career growth, it also requires a significant commitment. So if you like the role and are ready to give your very best, don't hesitate to apply.

The selection process
If you pass our screening, we‚Äôll ask you to take on a few tests that assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. If you‚Äôre successful with those, we‚Äôll invite you to a series of interviews.

Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment any applicant and we provide reasonable accommodations for an applicant with disabilities, which can be requested through this form.

Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isn‚Äôt a perfect fit. Here, talent takes precedence over experience. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it in time, go ahead and apply.

Title: System Engineer
Description:
2 weeks ago Be among the first 25 applicants

Direct message the job poster from ABIONICA SOLUTIONS

OFFER FOR SYSTEMS ENGINEER Who we are. We are an experienced team in the Unmanned industry providing professional engineering solutions for the aerospace industry, supporting the design, development, and integration of flight control technology for unmanned aerial systems (UAS).

Job location:Alicante, Spain.

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Systems Engineer to contribute to the development, integration, and qualification of electrical power systems, payload systems, actuation systems, and communication systems for unmanned aircraft systems (UAS).

The ideal candidate will have a strong background in aerospace, electrical, or systems engineering and experience with system qualification under MIL-STD-810 and MIL-STD-461.

Responsibilities. Lead the design, development, integration, andqualification ofelectrical power, payload, actuation, and communication systems for UAS.Performsystems engineering tasks, including requirements definition, system architecture development, trade studies, and risk analysis.Ensure system compliance with MIL-STD-810 and MIL-STD-461, including environmental and electromagnetic interference (EMI/EMC) testing.Defineverification and validation (V&V) activities, including component- and system-level testing in laboratory and flight environments.Work closely with regulatory bodies to ensure compliance with relevantaviation standards and regulations.Identify and troubleshootsystem integration challenges, implementing effective solutions.Supporttechnical documentation, including system specifications, design documents, test plans, and qualification reports.Providetechnical guidance and mentorship to junior engineers and team members.Candidate Profile. Title: Graduate Software Engineer (remote)
Description:
At Bending Spoons, we‚Äôre striving to build one of the all-time great companies. A company that serves a huge number of customers. A company where team members grow to their full potential. A company that functions at unparalleled levels of effectiveness and efficiency. A company that creates value for shareowners at an extraordinary rate. And a company that does so while adhering to high ethical standards.

To achieve this objective, we execute the following strategy: We acquire a digital business with untapped potential and make it as successful as we can by leveraging our platform‚Äîwhich comprises our expertise, technologies, data, brand, talents, and company culture. Then, we invest the proceeds into making our platform more powerful, and into acquiring new businesses. Thus, our strategy sees us combine an investor‚Äôs attention to capital allocation with the hands-on approach of an operator.

For a talented, driven, and collaborative individual, working at Bending Spoons is an opportunity to learn, make an impact, and progress their career at an exceptionally high rate. That‚Äôs our promise to such a candidate.

A few examples of your responsibilities
Master your toolkit. By working across diverse tech stacks, you‚Äôll refine your ability to choose the right tools for every challenge. From monolithic to microservices architectures, gRPC to REST APIs, Kubernetes to Docker, Python to Rust‚Äîyou‚Äôll show that true expertise isn‚Äôt about using the trendiest technologies, but about understanding their purpose to unleash their full potential.
Build stuff that matters. Regardless of your seniority, you‚Äôll enjoy plenty of autonomy and take full ownership of your work, from ideation to execution. You‚Äôll have the unique opportunity to build software from the ground up and witness firsthand how your code evolves into a product used at scale.
Simplify relentlessly. Is every component essential? Do we need this process? As a Bending Spoons engineer, your mission is to turn complexity into simplicity. Whether optimizing CI/CD pipelines, writing maintainable code, or crafting minimalist architectures, your drive to simplify will power scalable, future-proof solutions.


What we look for
Reasoning ability. Given the necessary knowledge, you can solve complex problems. You think from first principles, and structure your ideas sharply. You resist the influence of biases. You identify and take care of the details that matter.
Drive. You‚Äôre extremely ambitious in everything you do‚Äîand your initiative, effort, and tenacity match the intensity of your ambition. You feel deeply responsible for your work. You hold yourself to a high‚Äîand rising‚Äîbar.
Team spirit. You give generously and without the expectation of receiving in return. You support the best idea, not your idea. You're always happy to get your hands dirty to help your team. You‚Äôre reliable, honest, and transparent.
Proficiency in English. You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.


What we offer
Incredibly talented, entrepreneurial teams. You‚Äôll work in small, result-oriented, autonomous teams alongside some of the brightest people in your field.
An exceptional opportunity for growth. We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potential‚Äîthen, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you‚Äôve got what it takes, you‚Äôll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.
Competitive pay and access to equity in the company. Typically, we offer an individual at the start of their career a salary of ¬£66,779 in the UK and ‚Ç¨63,965 elsewhere. If they possess a few years of relevant experience, the salary on offer tends to be between ¬£110,389 and ¬£149,636 in the UK, and ‚Ç¨105,737 and ‚Ç¨143,330 elsewhere. Pay grows rapidly as you accumulate experience and translate it into greater impact. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.
All. These. Benefits. Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top-of-the-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.


Commitment & contract
Permanent or fixed-term. Full-time.

Location
Milan (Italy), London (UK) or remote.

Before you apply
Bending Spoons is a demanding environment: We're extremely ambitious and we ask a lot of ourselves and one another. While this tends to lead to fantastic learning, achievements, and career growth, it also requires a significant commitment. So if you like the role and are ready to give your very best, don't hesitate to apply.

The selection process
If you pass our screening, we‚Äôll ask you to take on a few tests that assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. If you‚Äôre successful with those, we‚Äôll invite you to a series of interviews.

Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment any applicant and we provide reasonable accommodations for an applicant with disabilities, which can be requested through this form.

Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isn‚Äôt a perfect fit. Here, talent takes precedence over experience. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it in time, go ahead and apply.

Description:

Title: Security Engineer (relocate to London)
Description:
At Bending Spoons, we‚Äôre striving to build one of the all-time great companies. A company that serves a huge number of customers. A company where team members grow to their full potential. A company that functions at unparalleled levels of effectiveness and efficiency. A company that creates value for shareowners at an extraordinary rate. And a company that does so while adhering to high ethical standards.

To achieve this objective, we execute the following strategy: We acquire a digital business with untapped potential and make it as successful as we can by leveraging our platform‚Äîwhich comprises our expertise, technologies, data, brand, talents, and company culture. Then, we invest the proceeds into making our platform more powerful, and into acquiring new businesses. Thus, our strategy sees us combine an investor‚Äôs attention to capital allocation with the hands-on approach of an operator.

For a talented, driven, and collaborative individual, working at Bending Spoons is an opportunity to learn, make an impact, and progress their career at an exceptionally high rate. That‚Äôs our promise to such a candidate.

A few examples of your responsibilities
Run security audits, identifying security loopholes and opportunities to enhance the effectiveness of security strategies.
Perform internal vulnerability testing, uncovering any weaknesses in the systems and implementing countermeasures to ensure the integrity of all data.
Identify company-wide security challenges. Design and implement solutions to strengthen protection and streamline security practices across IT and infrastructure areas.
Collaborate closely with privacy experts to ensure the most robust and complete privacy compliance strategy possible, and to translate regulations into tech implementations.
Stay up to date with security trends and threats. Share knowledge with Spooners to ensure data protection best practices and help foster a security-focused culture across the company.


What we look for
Reasoning ability. Given the necessary knowledge, you can solve complex problems. You think from first principles, and structure your ideas sharply. You resist the influence of biases. You identify and take care of the details that matter.
Drive. You‚Äôre extremely ambitious in everything you do‚Äîand your initiative, effort, and tenacity match the intensity of your ambition. You feel deeply responsible for your work. You hold yourself to a high‚Äîand rising‚Äîbar.
Team spirit. You give generously and without the expectation of receiving in return. You support the best idea, not your idea. You're always happy to get your hands dirty to help your team. You‚Äôre reliable, honest, and transparent.
Proficiency in English. You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.


What we offer
Incredibly talented, entrepreneurial teams. You‚Äôll work in small, result-oriented, autonomous teams alongside some of the brightest people in your field.
An exceptional opportunity for growth. We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potential‚Äîthen, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you‚Äôve got what it takes, you‚Äôll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.
Competitive pay and access to equity in the company. Typically, we offer an individual at the start of their career a salary of ¬£66,779 in the UK and ‚Ç¨63,965 elsewhere. If they possess a few years of relevant experience, the salary on offer tends to be between ¬£110,389 and ¬£149,636 in the UK, and ‚Ç¨105,737 and ‚Ç¨143,330 elsewhere. Pay grows rapidly as you accumulate experience and translate it into greater impact. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.
All. These. Benefits. Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top-of-the-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.


Commitment & contract
Permanent or fixed-term. Full-time or part-time.

Location
Milan (Italy), London (UK) or remote.

Before you apply
Bending Spoons is a demanding environment: We're extremely ambitious and we ask a lot of ourselves and one another. While this tends to lead to fantastic learning, achievements, and career growth, it also requires a significant commitment. So if you like the role and are ready to give your very best, don't hesitate to apply.

The selection process
If you pass our screening, we‚Äôll ask you to take on a few tests that assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. If you‚Äôre successful with those, we‚Äôll invite you to a series of interviews.

Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment any applicant and we provide reasonable accommodations for an applicant with disabilities, which can be requested through this form.

Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isn‚Äôt a perfect fit. Here, talent takes precedence over experience. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it in time, go ahead and apply.

Title: Software Engineer Intern (remote)
Description:
At Bending Spoons, we‚Äôre striving to build one of the all-time great companies. A company that serves a huge number of customers. A company where team members grow to their full potential. A company that functions at unparalleled levels of effectiveness and efficiency. A company that creates value for shareowners at an extraordinary rate. And a company that does so while adhering to high ethical standards.

To achieve this objective, we execute the following strategy: We acquire a digital business with untapped potential and make it as successful as we can by leveraging our platform‚Äîwhich comprises our expertise, technologies, data, brand, talents, and company culture. Then, we invest the proceeds into making our platform more powerful, and into acquiring new businesses. Thus, our strategy sees us combine an investor‚Äôs attention to capital allocation with the hands-on approach of an operator.

For a talented, driven, and collaborative individual, working at Bending Spoons is an opportunity to learn, make an impact, and progress their career at an exceptionally high rate. That‚Äôs our promise to such a candidate.

A few examples of your responsibilities
Master your toolkit. By working across diverse tech stacks, you‚Äôll refine your ability to choose the right tools for every challenge. From monolithic to microservices architectures, gRPC to REST APIs, Kubernetes to Docker, Python to Rust‚Äîyou‚Äôll show that true expertise isn‚Äôt about using the trendiest technologies, but about understanding their purpose to unleash their full potential.
Build stuff that matters. Regardless of your seniority, you‚Äôll enjoy plenty of autonomy and take full ownership of your work, from ideation to execution. You‚Äôll have the unique opportunity to build software from the ground up and witness firsthand how your code evolves into a product used at scale.
Simplify relentlessly. Is every component essential? Do we need this process? As a Bending Spoons engineer, your mission is to turn complexity into simplicity. Whether optimizing CI/CD pipelines, writing maintainable code, or crafting minimalist architectures, your drive to simplify will power scalable, future-proof solutions.


What we look for
Reasoning ability. Given the necessary knowledge, you can solve complex problems. You think from first principles, and structure your ideas sharply. You resist the influence of biases. You identify and take care of the details that matter.
Drive. You‚Äôre extremely ambitious in everything you do‚Äîand your initiative, effort, and tenacity match the intensity of your ambition. You feel deeply responsible for your work. You hold yourself to a high‚Äîand rising‚Äîbar.
Team spirit. You give generously and without the expectation of receiving in return. You support the best idea, not your idea. You're always happy to get your hands dirty to help your team. You‚Äôre reliable, honest, and transparent.
Proficiency in English. You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.
You can work at least 20 hours per week. A full-time commitment is preferred, but we‚Äôll consider applicants who can commit to at least 20 hours per week.


What we offer
Incredibly talented, entrepreneurial teams. You‚Äôll work in small, result-oriented, autonomous teams alongside some of the brightest people in your field.
An exceptional opportunity for growth. We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potential‚Äîthen, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you‚Äôve got what it takes, you‚Äôll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.
Competitive pay and access to equity in the company. Typically, we offer an individual at the start of their career a salary of ¬£66,779 in the UK and ‚Ç¨63,965 elsewhere. If they possess a few years of relevant experience, the salary on offer tends to be between ¬£110,389 and ¬£149,636 in the UK, and ‚Ç¨105,737 and ‚Ç¨143,330 elsewhere. Pay grows rapidly as you accumulate experience and translate it into greater impact. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.
All. These. Benefits. Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top-of-the-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.


Commitment & contract
Internship. Full-time or part-time.

Location
Milan (Italy), London (UK) or remote.

Before you apply
Bending Spoons is a demanding environment: We're extremely ambitious and we ask a lot of ourselves and one another. While this tends to lead to fantastic learning, achievements, and career growth, it also requires a significant commitment. So if you like the role and are ready to give your very best, don't hesitate to apply.

The selection process
If you pass our screening, we‚Äôll ask you to take on a few tests that assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. If you‚Äôre successful with those, we‚Äôll invite you to a series of interviews.

Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment any applicant and we provide reasonable accommodations for an applicant with disabilities, which can be requested through this form.

Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isn‚Äôt a perfect fit. Here, talent takes precedence over experience. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it in time, go ahead and apply.

  • An exceptional opportunity for growth. We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potential‚Äîthen, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you‚Äôve got what it takes, you‚Äôll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.
  • Competitive pay and access to equity in the company. Typically, we offer an individual at the start of their career a salary of ¬£66,779 in the UK and ‚Ç¨63,965 elsewhere. If they possess a few years of relevant experience, the salary on offer tends to be between ¬£110,389 and ¬£149,636 in the UK, and ‚Ç¨105,737 and ‚Ç¨143,330 elsewhere. Pay grows rapidly as you accumulate experience and translate it into greater impact. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.
  • All. These. Benefits. Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top-of-the-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.

Commitment & contract
Internship. Full-time or part-time.

Location
Milan (Italy), London (UK) or remote.

Before you apply
Bending Spoons is a demanding environment: We're extremely ambitious and we ask a lot of ourselves and one another. While this tends to lead to fantastic learning, achievements, and career growth, it also requires a significant commitment. So if you like the role and are ready to give your very best, don't hesitate to apply.

The selection process
If you pass our screening, we‚Äôll ask you to take on a few tests that assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. If you‚Äôre successful with those, we‚Äôll invite you to a series of interviews.

Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment any applicant and we provide reasonable accommodations for an applicant with disabilities, which can be requested through this form.

Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isn‚Äôt a perfect fit. Here, talent takes precedence over experience. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it in time, go ahead and apply.

Title: PhD Students and Postdoc Positions on Knowledge-Driven 6G Networks for Connected Mobility and Smart Manufacturing
Description:
The UWICORE laboratory at the Universidad Miguel Hern√°ndez (UMH) de Elche (Spain) offers several PhD student & post-doc positions on Knowledge-Driven 6G Networks for Connected Mobility and Smart Manufacturing.


Tasks


Future smart networks, including 6G, should go beyond pure communication systems and integrate sustainably computing, sensing, intelligence and connectivity capabilities for a proactive and knowledge-driven management of communications and networks solutions that will scalably and reliably support deterministic service levels and control processes. This should include hybrid intelligence solutions with reasoning capabilities to shift the focus of communications from the reliable and timely delivery of data to the semantic and goal-oriented transmission of data that is relevant and valuable. In this context, our lab is offering several research positions on the following topics:





Design of novel Artificial Intelligence (AI)-based solutions (including generative AI) to process and interpret contextual information for generating collective awareness, predict the evolution of context, and determine the relevance and semantic value of information for optimizing the efficiency and scalability of 6G communications and networks.


Causal reasoning mechanims to facilitate explainability, improve accuracy and reduce computational cost of AI-based knowledge generation for the design of 6G communications and networks.


Study the role of infrastructure (with additional sensing capabilities) for collaboratively improving the knowlegde generation with devices and sensors.


Design of knowledge-driven, AI-based, and semantic and goal-oriented 6G networking protocols for improving the scalability of networks and the capacity to sustain deterministic service levels. The research will focus on the opportunities, challenges and priorities of Connected and Automated Mobility (CAM, including V2X networks) and smart manufacturing, two verticals in which the lab has significant expertise. Both verticals embed expanding connectivity, processing, sensing, autonomy, control, and AI capabilities that empower a more cognitive and cost-effective management of future networks.



Requirements


PhD candidates should have a Master in Computer Science or Engineering, Telecoms, or Electrical Engineering (or closely related disciplines). Interest or experience in one of the following topics is required: 5G and beyond wireless networks, Artificial Intelligence (Deep Learning, Reinforcement Learning), V2X communications, autonomous systems (e.g. connected and automated vehicles, and smart robots in manufacturing). The candidate should have good programming skills (e.g. C++, Python) as well as good theoretical foundations, analytical modelling and critical thinking skills. Publications in journals and conferences are positively considered but not required. Experience with machine learning software (PyTorch, Keras, or TensorFlow) is a plus. Good English writing and speaking skills are required, as well as team working attitude, and self‚Äêmotivation.




Post-doc candidates should have a PhD in Computer, Telecoms, Electrical or Robotics Engineering (or closely related fields), and a high-quality track record of publications in relevant journals and conferences. Preferably, the candidate should have done the PhD or have experience in one of the following research topics: AI, design of wireless networks, V2X communications, autonomous driving. Proficiency in programming languages such as C++ and Python, and experience with software development, debugging, and deployment is required. Experience with machine learning software such as PyTorch, Keras, or TensorFlow is a plus. Strong theoretical foundations and analytical modelling experience are also a plus. Critical thinking skills, team working attitude, and self-motivation are required. Proficiency in English writing and speaking is also required.


Benefits



Contract duration: 2 years for post-docs and 3 years for PhD students.


Starting date: as soon as possible.





Interested candidates should send their application by email. The application is open until all positions are filled. Candidates should send their Curriculum Vitae and their Academic Certificate and transcript of records to Prof. Javier Gozalvez (j.gozalvez umh es), Dr. Baldomero Coll-Perales (bcoll umh es) and Dr. Luca Lusvarghi (llusvarghi umh es). The subject of the email should be ‚ÄúPositions on Knowledge-Driven 6G Networks - Candidate name‚Äù. Applications will be continuously evaluated upon reception, and online interviews will be organized with the selected candidates until all positions are filled.

Title: Software Engineer Intern (relocate to Milan)
Description:
At Bending Spoons, we‚Äôre striving to build one of the all-time great companies. A company that serves a huge number of customers. A company where team members grow to their full potential. A company that functions at unparalleled levels of effectiveness and efficiency. A company that creates value for shareowners at an extraordinary rate. And a company that does so while adhering to high ethical standards.

To achieve this objective, we execute the following strategy: We acquire a digital business with untapped potential and make it as successful as we can by leveraging our platform‚Äîwhich comprises our expertise, technologies, data, brand, talents, and company culture. Then, we invest the proceeds into making our platform more powerful, and into acquiring new businesses. Thus, our strategy sees us combine an investor‚Äôs attention to capital allocation with the hands-on approach of an operator.

For a talented, driven, and collaborative individual, working at Bending Spoons is an opportunity to learn, make an impact, and progress their career at an exceptionally high rate. That‚Äôs our promise to such a candidate.

A few examples of your responsibilities
Master your toolkit. By working across diverse tech stacks, you‚Äôll refine your ability to choose the right tools for every challenge. From monolithic to microservices architectures, gRPC to REST APIs, Kubernetes to Docker, Python to Rust‚Äîyou‚Äôll show that true expertise isn‚Äôt about using the trendiest technologies, but about understanding their purpose to unleash their full potential.
Build stuff that matters. Regardless of your seniority, you‚Äôll enjoy plenty of autonomy and take full ownership of your work, from ideation to execution. You‚Äôll have the unique opportunity to build software from the ground up and witness firsthand how your code evolves into a product used at scale.
Simplify relentlessly. Is every component essential? Do we need this process? As a Bending Spoons engineer, your mission is to turn complexity into simplicity. Whether optimizing CI/CD pipelines, writing maintainable code, or crafting minimalist architectures, your drive to simplify will power scalable, future-proof solutions.


What we look for
Reasoning ability. Given the necessary knowledge, you can solve complex problems. You think from first principles, and structure your ideas sharply. You resist the influence of biases. You identify and take care of the details that matter.
Drive. You‚Äôre extremely ambitious in everything you do‚Äîand your initiative, effort, and tenacity match the intensity of your ambition. You feel deeply responsible for your work. You hold yourself to a high‚Äîand rising‚Äîbar.
Team spirit. You give generously and without the expectation of receiving in return. You support the best idea, not your idea. You're always happy to get your hands dirty to help your team. You‚Äôre reliable, honest, and transparent.
Proficiency in English. You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.
You can work at least 20 hours per week. A full-time commitment is preferred, but we‚Äôll consider applicants who can commit to at least 20 hours per week.


What we offer
Incredibly talented, entrepreneurial teams. You‚Äôll work in small, result-oriented, autonomous teams alongside some of the brightest people in your field.
An exceptional opportunity for growth. We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potential‚Äîthen, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you‚Äôve got what it takes, you‚Äôll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.
Competitive pay and access to equity in the company. Typically, we offer an individual at the start of their career a salary of ¬£66,779 in the UK and ‚Ç¨63,965 elsewhere. If they possess a few years of relevant experience, the salary on offer tends to be between ¬£110,389 and ¬£149,636 in the UK, and ‚Ç¨105,737 and ‚Ç¨143,330 elsewhere. Pay grows rapidly as you accumulate experience and translate it into greater impact. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.
All. These. Benefits. Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top-of-the-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.


Commitment & contract
Internship. Full-time or part-time.

Location
Milan (Italy), London (UK) or remote.

Before you apply
Bending Spoons is a demanding environment: We're extremely ambitious and we ask a lot of ourselves and one another. While this tends to lead to fantastic learning, achievements, and career growth, it also requires a significant commitment. So if you like the role and are ready to give your very best, don't hesitate to apply.

The selection process
If you pass our screening, we‚Äôll ask you to take on a few tests that assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. If you‚Äôre successful with those, we‚Äôll invite you to a series of interviews.

Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment any applicant and we provide reasonable accommodations for an applicant with disabilities, which can be requested through this form.

Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isn‚Äôt a perfect fit. Here, talent takes precedence over experience. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it in time, go ahead and apply.

Title: System Architecture Engineer
Description:
About PLD:

Founded in 2011, PLD Space is a high-tech engineering, manufacturing and service-driven company, with deep track record and expertise in space launch technologies.

We are a trusted global championing industry leader disrupting the pathway to space access. We are on a mission to reach new hights by making space more accesible, supporting missions that will make us smarter, safer and wealthier.

Our purpose is to propel new futures, to enable progress from space and enrich peoples‚Äô lives on Earth, by moving new economies, people and world forward.




Mission

System Architecture Junior Engineer with a passion for systems engineering and technological architecture design. In this role, you will work closely with multidisciplinary teams to define, develop, and optimize system architectures in the aerospace sector.




Responsibilities

Support the definition and documentation of system architecture, including components, interfaces, and requirements.
Collaborate with hardware, software, and testing teams to ensure efficient system integration.
Conduct feasibility analyses and evaluate different technological solutions.
Asist in generating models and simulations to validate system designs.
Participate in identifying and mitigating technical risks.
Contribute to process improvement and systems engineering methodologies.







Necessary Requirements

Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Electrical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, Systems Engineering, or a related field.
Strong experience in designing and developing test benches for aerospace or complex engineering systems.
Proficiency in hardware-in-the-loop (HIL) and software-in-the-loop (SIL) testing methodologies.
Experience with test automation tools, measurement systems, and data acquisition.
Knowledge of aerospace standards and regulations (AISI, UNE-EN, ASTM, etc)
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and leadership abilities.
Experience with programming languages such as Python, C/C++, or LabVIEW is a plus.







Desired Requirements

Hard work and availability.
Interpersonal skills.
Excellent communication skills, including fluency in English.
Problem-solving oriented and decision making oriented.
Enthusiast.
Risk anticipation and mitigation oriented.




Benefits

Health & Wellness

Physiotherapy within our facilities
50% discount on your health insurance
You can sign-up your family members with health insurance at a competitive price.
Healthy snacks and lots of fruit

Find balance

23 days of paid vacation plus December 24th and 31st
Flexible work schedule

Never stop learning

We encourage practical learning
We promote professional development through internal mobility and teamwork

Focus on your financial future

Childcare flexible contributions
Restaurant tickets
Transport flexible contributions
Training support

Values

We have five critical beliefs that guide the way PLD Space is shaping the future of space launch technologies.

Teamwork.
Hard work.
Dynamism.
Commitment.
Keep it simple.

Title: Senior AI Engineer
Description:
Teralco Group nace en 2002 y se convierte en CONVOTIS Iberia en 2024. Desde entonces, hemos estado comprometidos con ayudar a las empresas a mejorar su rendimiento y eficiencia a trav√©s del uso de tecnolog√≠a innovadora. Con nuestros m√°s de 20 a√±os de experiencia, hemos ayudado a numerosas compa√±√≠as a implementar soluciones tecnol√≥gicas.

En CONVOTIS Iberia¬†T√∫ sumas con tu experiencia y habilidades, T√∫ importas en nuestra toma de decisiones y T√∫ eliges el camino para tu desarrollo profesional.

¬øC√≥mo es un d√≠a en CONVOTIS Iberia?

Eliges cu√°ndo comienza tu jornada laboral y acabas cuando quieras.

Si haces tiempo de m√°s un d√≠a o sales antes por necesidades personales, lo compensas otro d√≠a sin problemas. Elige si vas a la oficina o no, porque tienes 100% #flexibilidad para ello.

Si te pasa algo durante tu jornada laboral,¬†tienes seguro m√©dico disponible. As√≠ que, tranquilo/a, que est√°s cubierto.

En los siguientes meses podr√°s acudir a los eventos que hacemos en la oficina (d√≠a de cerveza gratis, gamefest, etc), en la monta√±a, en jornadas l√∫dicas (2 al a√±o), jugando al p√°del y un mont√≥n de cosas m√°s.

Title: Salesforce Marketing Cloud Developer
Description:
Omega CRM is a Merkle & Dentsu company, leader in development of Customer Experience services, with +20 years of experience in the use of Technology applied to Marketing and providing a unique Customer Relationship with mainly focus on Innovation is looking for a Salesforce Marketing Cloud Developer.

Main responsibilities:


Participate in analysis for marketing automation and martech solution development.
Participate in the implementation of marketing cloud development infrastructure.
Participate in analyzing clients' specific marketing and technology needs and contribute to communication processes in systems by implementing developments.
Perform basic technical and specialized marketing tasks.
Implement and develop the necessary processes to run cloud-oriented marketing automation solutions.
Launch developments and automation processes that best suit cloud implementation.
Participate in development consulting services to ensure that automated communication processes run smoothly.
Implement the necessary developments to activate automated communications and marketing automation processes that meet clients' needs at different touchpoints with their contacts.
Participate in implementing the latest technological advances and marketing technology solutions.
Perform test trials, error diagnostics, and resolve development issues in the use of marketing automation and martech tools.
Document development processes and track system performance metrics.
Work on cloud integrations using different programming and development languages: Javascript, Ampscript, Server-Side Javascript, API.
Meet the agreed-upon software quality standards with Omega's technical management.


Skills


Minimum of 3 years of experience in a similar role
Experience in Data Cloud and Personalization projects.
Proficiency in SQL, AMPscript, and JavaScript
Experience in HTML and CSS development
Salesforce certifications are an asset.
High level of English


What Do We Offer


Permanent contract.
Flexible Schedule. We make it easy. Balance your professional and personal life.
Trainings & Certifications. Improve your skills and get the official certificate from our main partners.
Home Office.
Flexible retribution (public transport ticket, Ticket restaurant, ‚Ä¶).
Health insurance.
OMEGA in action. Our commitment to a better society is not just an intention.


About Us

Omega CRM, a Merkle Company, is a global digital company specialising in accelerating the Business Experience (BX) of our clients through customer-centric solutions, technology, and data ‚Äì all enhanced by AI.

Together with Merkle, we form the largest Customer Experience Management (CXM) agency in Spain, and as part of the dentsu group, we offer end-to-end solutions that integrate media, creativity, content, technology, and strategy to deliver real business impact.

With over 23 years of experience, a team of 580+ professionals from 24 nationalities, and 2,500+ certifications, Omega CRM is a recognised leader in the Salesforce ecosystem in Spain.

We operate across key industries including Retail, Healthcare, Pharma, Real Estate, Education, and Non-Profit, delivering omnichannel experiences in Customer Service, eCommerce, Marketing, and Analytics.

Client satisfaction is at our core (rating: 4.9/5), and we‚Äôve been recognised with awards such as Salesforce Partner of the Year FY23 and Most Innovative Project (Iberia).

At Omega CRM, we believe in growth through people ‚Äì guided by our values: #Talent, #Flexibility, #Commitment, and #Innovation. We grow #Together.

Title: Software Engineer (remote)
Description:
At Bending Spoons, we‚Äôre striving to build one of the all-time great companies. A company that serves a huge number of customers. A company where team members grow to their full potential. A company that functions at unparalleled levels of effectiveness and efficiency. A company that creates value for shareowners at an extraordinary rate. And a company that does so while adhering to high ethical standards.

To achieve this objective, we execute the following strategy: We acquire a digital business with untapped potential and make it as successful as we can by leveraging our platform‚Äîwhich comprises our expertise, technologies, data, brand, talents, and company culture. Then, we invest the proceeds into making our platform more powerful, and into acquiring new businesses. Thus, our strategy sees us combine an investor‚Äôs attention to capital allocation with the hands-on approach of an operator.

For a talented, driven, and collaborative individual, working at Bending Spoons is an opportunity to learn, make an impact, and progress their career at an exceptionally high rate. That‚Äôs our promise to such a candidate.

A few examples of your responsibilities
Master your toolkit. By working across diverse tech stacks, you‚Äôll refine your ability to choose the right tools for every challenge. From monolithic to microservices architectures, gRPC to REST APIs, Kubernetes to Docker, Python to Rust‚Äîyou‚Äôll show that true expertise isn‚Äôt about using the trendiest technologies, but about understanding their purpose to unleash their full potential.
Build stuff that matters. Regardless of your seniority, you‚Äôll enjoy plenty of autonomy and take full ownership of your work, from ideation to execution. You‚Äôll have the unique opportunity to build software from the ground up and witness firsthand how your code evolves into a product used at scale.
Simplify relentlessly. Is every component essential? Do we need this process? As a Bending Spoons engineer, your mission is to turn complexity into simplicity. Whether optimizing CI/CD pipelines, writing maintainable code, or crafting minimalist architectures, your drive to simplify will power scalable, future-proof solutions.


What we look for
Reasoning ability. Given the necessary knowledge, you can solve complex problems. You think from first principles, and structure your ideas sharply. You resist the influence of biases. You identify and take care of the details that matter.
Drive. You‚Äôre extremely ambitious in everything you do‚Äîand your initiative, effort, and tenacity match the intensity of your ambition. You feel deeply responsible for your work. You hold yourself to a high‚Äîand rising‚Äîbar.
Team spirit. You give generously and without the expectation of receiving in return. You support the best idea, not your idea. You're always happy to get your hands dirty to help your team. You‚Äôre reliable, honest, and transparent.
Proficiency in English. You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.


What we offer
Incredibly talented, entrepreneurial teams. You‚Äôll work in small, result-oriented, autonomous teams alongside some of the brightest people in your field.
An exceptional opportunity for growth. We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potential‚Äîthen, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you‚Äôve got what it takes, you‚Äôll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.

If they possess a few years of relevant experience, the salary on offer tends to be between ¬£110,389 and ¬£149,636 in the UK, and ‚Ç¨105,737 and ‚Ç¨143,330 elsewhere. Pay grows rapidly as you accumulate experience and translate it into greater impact. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.
All. These. Benefits. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.

Title: Software Engineer (relocate to Milan)
Description:
At Bending Spoons, we‚Äôre striving to build one of the all-time great companies. A company that serves a huge number of customers. A company where team members grow to their full potential. A company that functions at unparalleled levels of effectiveness and efficiency. A company that creates value for shareowners at an extraordinary rate. And a company that does so while adhering to high ethical standards.

To achieve this objective, we execute the following strategy: We acquire a digital business with untapped potential and make it as successful as we can by leveraging our platform‚Äîwhich comprises our expertise, technologies, data, brand, talents, and company culture. Then, we invest the proceeds into making our platform more powerful, and into acquiring new businesses. Thus, our strategy sees us combine an investor‚Äôs attention to capital allocation with the hands-on approach of an operator.

For a talented, driven, and collaborative individual, working at Bending Spoons is an opportunity to learn, make an impact, and progress their career at an exceptionally high rate. That‚Äôs our promise to such a candidate.

A few examples of your responsibilities
Master your toolkit. By working across diverse tech stacks, you‚Äôll refine your ability to choose the right tools for every challenge. From monolithic to microservices architectures, gRPC to REST APIs, Kubernetes to Docker, Python to Rust‚Äîyou‚Äôll show that true expertise isn‚Äôt about using the trendiest technologies, but about understanding their purpose to unleash their full potential.
Build stuff that matters. Regardless of your seniority, you‚Äôll enjoy plenty of autonomy and take full ownership of your work, from ideation to execution. You‚Äôll have the unique opportunity to build software from the ground up and witness firsthand how your code evolves into a product used at scale.
Simplify relentlessly. Is every component essential? Do we need this process? As a Bending Spoons engineer, your mission is to turn complexity into simplicity. Whether optimizing CI/CD pipelines, writing maintainable code, or crafting minimalist architectures, your drive to simplify will power scalable, future-proof solutions.


What we look for
Reasoning ability. Given the necessary knowledge, you can solve complex problems. You think from first principles, and structure your ideas sharply. You resist the influence of biases. You identify and take care of the details that matter.
Drive. You‚Äôre extremely ambitious in everything you do‚Äîand your initiative, effort, and tenacity match the intensity of your ambition. You feel deeply responsible for your work. You hold yourself to a high‚Äîand rising‚Äîbar.
Team spirit. You give generously and without the expectation of receiving in return. You support the best idea, not your idea. You're always happy to get your hands dirty to help your team. You‚Äôre reliable, honest, and transparent.
Proficiency in English. You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.


What we offer
Incredibly talented, entrepreneurial teams. You‚Äôll work in small, result-oriented, autonomous teams alongside some of the brightest people in your field.
An exceptional opportunity for growth. We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potential‚Äîthen, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you‚Äôve got what it takes, you‚Äôll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.
Competitive pay and access to equity in the company. Typically, we offer an individual at the start of their career a salary of ¬£66,779 in the UK and ‚Ç¨63,965 elsewhere. If they possess a few years of relevant experience, the salary on offer tends to be between ¬£110,389 and ¬£149,636 in the UK, and ‚Ç¨105,737 and ‚Ç¨143,330 elsewhere. Pay grows rapidly as you accumulate experience and translate it into greater impact. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.
All. These. Benefits. Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top-of-the-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.

/ What'll you be doing1er mes | OnboardingNos sentaremos contigo para explicarte el negocio, presentarte al equipo, mostrarte c√≥mo trabajamos, las herramientas qu√© utilizamos y ofrecerte todo lo que necesites en los primeros d√≠as de tu incorporaci√≥n.Nuestro equipo de tecnolog√≠a te ense√±ar√° nuestro stack, conocer√°s a todos los miembros del equipo, todo el contexto necesario para entender el proyecto y el entorno en el que trabajar√°s.Seguramente entres a mitad de alg√∫n sprint.

Arrancamos todos los d√≠as con una daily muy distendida de compa√±√≠a a las 10am, para contar brevemente c√≥mo avanzamos cada uno en nuestros proyectos, y posteriormente cada equipo asiste a sus dailies propias.En este primer mes tanto tus compa√±eros de desarrollo como nuestros project managers te acompa√±ar√°n y dar√°n soporte con todo lo que necesites para el proyecto en el que vayas a trabajar.Nos comunicamos principalmente por Discord, documentamos en Drive y Notion y utilizamos meets para las reuniones.

Tambi√©n solemos trabajar con Monday, Trello y Jira, en funci√≥n del proyecto.Durante los siguientes mesesA medida que te vayas familiarizando con el proyecto, el equipo y el stack, podr√°s ayudar a estimar las tareas y desarrollos que nos ayuden a priorizar el backlog proyecto.Parte de los sprints contendr√°n trabajos de mejora para optimizar el rendimiento, refactorizar, eliminar legacy, evitar cuellos de botella y en definitiva mejorar la escalabilidad a futuro.Fomentamos activamente que nuestros compa√±er@s aporten propuestas y que si tienen una idea la compartan sin miedo, ya sean mejoras para desarrollos existentes, como nuevas funcionalidades que puedan impactar de forma positiva en los proyectos en los que trabajar√°s.Como coment√°bamos m√°s arriba, valoramos la capacidad de trabajar en equipo, la buena comunicaci√≥n, la calidad del software y las buenas pr√°cticas.En Secture no paramos de crecer, por lo tanto, queremos que te conviertas en un pilar del equipo y nos ayudes a seguir construyendo nuestros proyectos, equipo y cultura.¬øQu√© esperamos de ti?Qu√© hayas trabajado al menos 4 a√±os como Fullstack developer (especialmente en entornos con Ruby)Experiencia solida/familiarizado con el stack que trabajamos:Experiencia con Ruby y Sinatra, o en su defecto RoRReactJSMySQL, MongoDB, RedisRabbitMQ, SidekiqDockerAWSFlujos de CI/CD con GitlabTrabajar√°s en un proyecto muy atractivo con posibilidad de desarrollo interno.Importante tener un buen nivel de ingl√©s o al menos B1.Que disfrutes trabajando en remoto, acostumbrado a una comunicaci√≥n fluida a trav√©s de nuestros canales internos de compa√±√≠a.Capacidad para trabajar en equipo, as√≠ como para ayudar a otros compa√±er@s cuando lo necesiten.Acostumbrado a trabajar mano a mano con equipos de desarrollo y producto, buenas pr√°cticas y metodolog√≠as √°giles.Qu√© busques un proyecto enfocado en la calidad del software , producto y la calidad de equipo.¬øQu√© te ofrecemos?

/ What's in it for youBanda salarial acorde a tu experiencia.Trabajo en remoto 100%.
